ingredients.content: 42 oz pork loin, cubed (1½ in.), fat removed
2 oz fresh 'chile de árbol' chilies, to taste

preparations.content: Place pork, orange juice, salt, thyme, marjoram, oregano, bay leaves and vegetable shortening into mixing bowl and cook <b>70 min/212°F//speed <b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place chilies, water, tomatoes and garlic into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>, then cook <b>15 min/212°F/speed 1<b>.<b>
Add vinegar and salt, and mix <b>1 min/speed 5<b>-10, increasing speed gradually.<b> Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.

Place tomatoes, garlic, onions, water, oregano, salt and cumin into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 4<b>, and then cook <b>15 min/212°F/speed 1<b>. Blend <b>1 min/speed 5<b>-10, increasing speed gradually<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place onions, oregano, lime juice and salt into mixing bowl and chop <b>4 sec/speed 4<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Spread bread rolls with refried beans, fill with reserved pork and pour Tomato Sauce over top of the bread. Serve with reserved onions and Chili Sauce.
